job_tasks.phrase: maintain and improve our Conversational AI workflows by automating the data and ml processes
job_tasks.justification: This phrase describes the core software engineering task of maintaining and improving existing workflows, which includes automation, a common software development practice.

job_tasks.phrase: improve solutions like Chatbot Anna, Conversational IVR (Voicebot) and LLM-based Advisor Assist
job_tasks.justification: This indicates the integration and improvement of AI-powered solutions into existing products or services, a key aspect of software development in an AI context.

job_tasks.phrase: make sure that these conversations are getting resolved in an effective and friction free manner
job_tasks.justification: This describes the goal of improving user experience and system efficiency, which is a common objective in software engineering.

job_tasks.phrase: maintain and innovate on top of our conversational bot, Interactive voice response (IVR), and internal Advisor Assist tooling
job_tasks.justification: This highlights the ongoing development and enhancement of existing software systems, which falls under software development and integration.

job_tasks.phrase: maintaining, enhancing, and innovating our conversational solutions
job_tasks.justification: This directly refers to the software engineering tasks of upkeep, improvement, and innovation of existing solutions.

job_tasks.phrase: Setting up a medallion data architecture for analyses workflows
job_tasks.justification: This task involves designing and implementing a data architecture, which is a core data engineering responsibility.

job_tasks.phrase: implementing pipelines to evaluate LLM prompts
job_tasks.justification: This task is specific to generative AI and involves the development of processes to assess the effectiveness of prompts, a key aspect of prompt engineering.

job_tasks.phrase: implementing pipelines to evaluate classification algorithms
job_tasks.justification: This refers to the development and evaluation of machine learning models, which falls under model development.

job_tasks.phrase: design how we store and manually annotate data
job_tasks.justification: This task relates to data management, specifically the design of data storage and annotation processes, crucial for ML/GenAI.

job_tasks.phrase: migration from a major cloud based conversational AI platform to MS Copilot
job_tasks.justification: This involves integrating a new platform (MS Copilot) and migrating existing AI solutions, a significant software integration task.

job_tasks.phrase: empower our solutions with LLMs in a manner that is responsible, secure and reliable
job_tasks.justification: This describes the integration of LLMs into existing solutions with a focus on operational qualities like responsibility, security, and reliability, which are software engineering concerns.

soft_skills.phrase: You will be part of a multidisciplinary scrum team of data scientists, engineers and consultants.
soft_skills.justification: This highlights the collaborative nature of the role within a diverse team.

soft_skills.phrase: In the extended team (~50 colleagues) you will be working alongside data engineers, user experience designers, content writers and front- and backend developers.
soft_skills.justification: This emphasizes working with various other roles, indicating a need for broad collaboration.

soft_skills.phrase: enthusiastic colleague that will help us shape the future of Conversational AI
soft_skills.justification: The term 'enthusiastic' and the focus on shaping the future implies a willingness to learn and adapt to new developments in Conversational AI.

profile.rationale: The job ad focuses heavily on maintaining, improving, and integrating existing conversational AI solutions (Chatbot Anna, IVR, Advisor Assist) and migrating to new platforms like MS Copilot. While it mentions evaluating LLM prompts and classification algorithms, the core emphasis is on the software engineering aspects of automating workflows, ensuring reliability, security, and integrating these AI components into broader systems. The tasks are predominantly from Macro-Category A (Software Development & Integration), with some specific AI tasks (1.B.1, 1.B.2, 1.B.3) that support the integration and improvement of the AI-powered products. There is no indication of core model development or deep research into generative models themselves, nor a focus on traditional ML tasks. Therefore, the role is best classified as an AI-Adjacent Software Engineer.

confidence.reasoning: The job ad clearly outlines responsibilities related to maintaining and improving AI-powered systems and workflows, with specific mentions of LLMs and data pipelines. The tasks lean towards integration and automation within an existing product context. The profile assignment is quite clear, but a perfect score is not given as some of the AI-specific tasks are described at a high level, and the exact balance between pure software engineering and AI specialization could be slightly more explicit.
